definition: easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes

sentences.english: The prospect of a new trade war.
sentences.chinese: 一觸即發的新一輪貿易戰。

sentences.english: Later it became a supply base for the navy's campaign against the slave trade;
sentences.chinese: 後來該島成了英國海軍反奴隸貿易戰的後勤供應基地。

sentences.english: But trade war is not the solution.
sentences.chinese: 但貿易戰並非解決之道。

sentences.english: That would trigger a trade war in the middle of our Great Recession.
sentences.chinese: 在美國正處衰退之中，這將引發一場貿易戰。

sentences.english: Other economists say the U. S. would suffer greatly in a trade war.
sentences.chinese: 其他經濟學家表示，美國將在這場貿易戰中遭到重創。

sentences.english: And so far there have been no full-out trade wars.
sentences.chinese: 到目前爲止，貿易戰並沒有全面爆發。

sentences.english: As long as this leads to a shut-down of globalist trade agreements I am for it!
sentences.chinese: 只要貿易戰能關閉全球貿易協定，我就支持。

sentences.english: A currency or trade war has no winners.
sentences.chinese: 在一場貨幣戰或貿易戰中，沒有真正的贏家。

pinyin: mao4 yi4 bao3 hu4 zhu3 yi4

definition: (of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
could happen at any moment/on the verge
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
